intro: Satorkis, commonly known as the "buttercup plant," is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, often yellow or orange, cup-shaped flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of Europe, Asia, and North America. Satorkis typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is known for its toxic properties, containing compounds like protoanemonin that can cause skin irritation.
